column4: Is it possible to create the repository trees in my local disk? Can you suggest a doc to do this?
to mirror the ubuntu archive?  you can do that, one sec, I'll get the url.
do you have a doc that discusses how ubuntu structures these packages?
it's the same structure as debian...let me find the document
http://www.interparse.com/debianmirror/
wiki.ubuntu.com/RestrictedFormats, I don't think it's possible with totem
I've tried it in mandriva. How about mplayer?
yes, same file
you mean same libdvdcss2?
same url, I meant
ubuntu tends to just include them in the linux-restricted-modules packages
is that a repository I can add? Or I need to join a club or something?
eh? it's just a package to install...I'm pretty sure it's on the CD.
is it in the BTS?
bts?
the bug tracking system
newbie here, where can I see the bts?
bugzilla.ubuntu.com, laucnhpad.ubuntu.com/malone, bugs.debian.org
there probably isn't one
try asking on the user list
did your system boot?
yes
